Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Emily P
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on two separate trips to Rome and find it to be a great value. It is located near the train station and about a 20 minute walk to the Coliseum. Breakfast is basic and very good. It is near very good restaurants and a fairly safe neighborhood. During both stays, we had our own separate bathroom which was very clean and quiet. We highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Was less than I spected.”
Reviews.Author: HMSG
Reviews.Content: On a November 2011 trip to Europe the last city to visit was Rome. I was surprised when I arrived at the Hotel it was a hall way with stairs at the end (No handicap access...) in the fourth floor on a shared building (additional hotels and offices). Forget about bell service you have to carry your own luggage up the stairs to half of the first floor then in a small elevator to the fourth floor. When I saw the room it looked like an old hospital being converted to a Hotel. If someone smoked in the stairways you could smell the smoke in the room. If you like hard mattress you are in luck, even my Army bunk was softer. The continental breakfast was fine, the same we had in other better hotels trough out Europe. The rooms and bathroom where very clean always. Internet was not available in the room had to used it in the lobby, descent speeds.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay in Rome with our kid in November”
Reviews.Author: Guillaume F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at hoitel Argentina early in November 2011. We enjoyed it very much. We have booked a triple room. It was clean and spacious with a very spacious bathroom. Our 10 year old kid enjoyed it as well. The breakfast was ok, not fabulous but really enough for our city break. Location is ideal. We could walk to Coliseum as well as Pantheon or Pliazza del Popolo. Close to St Jean de Latran as well. Direct access to train station is also an asset. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for 1-2 nights only.”
Reviews.Author: lougatzo
Reviews.Content: Very close to teh Termini train station. It is really just a floor within a very old building that houses multiple "hotels" of the same type. It is good for just a night or maybe 2 just before your train or flight the next day. On a very busy street, but the windows seal very well. The hotel is smoke free, but the staff smokes just outside the front door, so you can smell it in the lobby. One thing I didn't like is you have to leave your room key at the front desk when you go out for dinner or something like that. I asked why, and they said it's for security. I asked, what about my security? and their reply, we can go into your room anytime anyway, so don't worry. Wierd. Breakfast is machine made coffee, yogurt, and processed crossiants. Nothing great. Again, if you need a place to crash for a night or two before you move on, this place is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Andosan
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel I stayed at in my adventures in Rome. It was conveniently located to Termini station which was a big plus. Nice friendly service and breakfast included. I had no complaints, tho the hotel does look a little old, but that's part of the culture there, overall great value

Reviews.Title: “We love Argentina Hotel”
Reviews.Author: McCubbins
Reviews.Content: It is just minutes from the Roma Termini. The staff are gracious and the breakfast is great. It is also in walking distance to many historical locations. A great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jonesyontour
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable hotel and good value for money. Situated near to the Termini which is great if you travel on the train from the airport into Rome. good size room, small bathroom but clean and comfortable. Fridge, telephone and TV all in room, supermarket around corner and continental breakfast was ample. Great city hotel for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: mahdri
Reviews.Content: I'm on my Eurotrip with my husband. We chose 4 cities and Rome was the third one. We loved the hotel in London, with a large room and were a little disappointed with the size of the Paris Hotel room, so we didn't know what to expect with this one, The hotel is on the 4th floor of a building in a major street 2 minutes from Termini Station. It's pretty easy to find, not a problem to walk there even with heavy lugagge. There is a elevator and it works just fine. What a surprise to find out that the room was large, the bed was confortable, there was an AC that worked perfectly and the bathroom was great!! Breakfast is simple but included, and it was good enough for us. The ONLY complain I have is the absense of wireless internet conection. Hopefully, by the time I go back to Europe, they will have fixed this "little problem", because I would love to stay with them again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: diversitylady
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a large, older building consisting of hotels or pensions on every floor. The Argentina is the highest starred hotel in the building and is on the fourth floor, reached by an ancient and tiny lift, or lots of wide, marble stairs. The hotel itself consists of probably not more than ten rooms and a small breakfast room. It has a permanently staffed reception. Pros: Great location for the rail and bus terminals and within easy walking distance of Santa Maria Maggiore, the Coliseum and Forum. We even walked back from Villa Borghese one afternoon in about 20 minutes. We had a 3 bed room (me and 2 older children) which was spacious enough and quiet with a large, airy bathroom. Both had windows that opened onto a quiet interior courtyard and full Italian style shutters. Breakfast was fine but not spectacular. We stayed at other three star hotels and had much better breakfasts. Plenty of restaurants nearby (try the side roads in particular). Cons: The breakfast room, reception area was certainly air conditioned. I think the rooms were supposed to be as well via a rather strange central vent in the ceiling, but it only was effective if you were lying directly underneath it. Fortunately, Rome wasn't particularly hot when we were there and we just slept with the sheets on the bed. I imagine the room would have been stifling in really hot weather. The reception staff was a rather mixed bag in terms of professionalism and helpfulness. One individual encouraged my faltering Italian and had quite good knowledge about bus services etc. Another spent a lot of the time chain smoking in the corridor directly outside the entrance to the hotel, with the result that the reception area and breakfast room often reeked of smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Old building, hotel on just a floor!!”
Reviews.Author: Rozmariee
Reviews.Content: The only thing positive that I could think about this hotel is its location. And when Isay location I do not mean that it was nice (not at all) but central as Termini station was 3 min on foot. The "hotel" is on the 4th floor of an old and dated building. The breakfast room is a 5 cm2 dark room. The room is too noisy, but clean and the bathroom is surely spacy. As my room was looking at the backyard of another building, it was too dark and even though it was clean, there was a funny bad smell coming from the toilet. The price for a single room was too high (82 euros) related to the quality. I would never go back at this dark, old, melancolic hotel. ps: one other positive thing that just came to my mind was the afternoon shift receptionist, he was too kind!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a small family on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: natb24
Reviews.Content: My husband and i travelled with our 18mth old. Found this hotel on the internet and was pleased with what we had. As rated the hotel was extremely clean and in a fantastic location 'if' you were wanting to sight see by walk. The Rome train station is literally 7-10min by walk. Bathroom facilities were great also. I would recommend this to a young family with one child...as there are no cot facilities. I have not seen the other rooms but if you email the hotel they are wonderful to answer any questions. I was however dissapointed with the airconditioning. After a full day of sightseeing in the heat, we arrived to very poor aircon on some days. The air was not consistant however when in room 106 (2 single beds..but tiny) you had an air con system in the room which was fantastic! Breakfast is above average and the staff and manager are extremely helpful. Overall a great hotel for a small family on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Location for a small budget”
Reviews.Author: liontraveller69
Reviews.Content: Are you a budget traveller in Rome? Hotel Argentina is the best for you. Hotel is situated just 5 minutes by walking distance to central termini area. The staff are helpful, they welcomes you with a small smile. Then when i entered in my room it was more then i expected: A comfortable bed, a small LCD TV, air conditioner, mini bar and very well furnished bathroom !! In the morning, the breakfast is small but fresh products and good service. This is a small hotel in the middle of Rome. In the evening you can find a lot of trottoria, pizzeria and bars in the streets behind. Viale Nazionale is just 5 to 10 minutes by walking distance. Unique inconveniant is about the room's view; my room was looking on the court so it was doing dark in the room. But: we don't come in Rome to stay in the room and watch the view... I definitelly recommend this hotel for all small budget travellers. You will not get disapointed if you do not expect a 5 stars cathegory. For a 3 stars hotel, they are more than "correct" !!!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelZItalia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so close to the main attractions. The room was immaculately clean and very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and even though I made an effort to speak Italian, they spoke very good English. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chico_Drogheda
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights and chose it based on the excellent reviews regarding it's location. We did not intend spending much time in the rooms and so comfort was not high on the agenda. If this is what you are looking for, the hotel is functional and adequate. The service was ok, room was dated with spotless clean shower room. Ours was a triple room with hard double bed and very soft camp bed. An old functional TV finished off the room. I'm not sure where the air conditioning was but I am sure there was a button somewhere. The hotel itself is on the 4th floor of an old but well maintained building which is within easy walking distance of Termini station. A very old lift which almost takes two persons and two cases will take you to the fourth floor. The express train from Fiumicino airport travels to and from Termini every 30 minutes which is very handy. Termini can also be used as a base to explore Rome city by Tour Bus. Breakfast is a typical continental one, nothing special, juice, coffee and the usual. Overall the hotel was adequate for our needs. As this was my first visit to Rome I would find it difficult to compare it for value. One thing to note is that there are a couple of other hotels in Rome with Argentina in the title so don't get confused like we did. As for recommending this hotel, it depends what you are looking for. For a short stay, spending minimum time at the hotel, it's ok.

Reviews.Title: “Preis/LEistung ok”
Reviews.Author: Miezekatze31
Reviews.Content: If you do not request high quality and you are satisfied without any fresh coffee in the morning and hard rolls - you are right! Clean room, noisy street , centrally located. for that price ok. wish for more comfort --than you are recommended to book elsewhere. Have a nice stay

Reviews.Title: “One star Hostel”
Reviews.Author: Maitzi
Reviews.Content: I just came back a week ago from Rome, Italy and I've stayed at Argentina Hotel, near Termini Station.The reason I chose this hotel was the location, 300 m away from Termini station and close to Colloseum, and because it looked nice, decent, clean hotel. Big mistake ! This so called hotel (better say hostel) it's located in a building together with 2 other hotels, at the 4th floor. On the building its written :'Hotels' and if you aren't carefull enough you might miss it.The real problem was the room itself, as it was really very small and the bath was awful. You can't sleep as you can hear everything from the reception or other rooms, I even heard my tv sound (and it wasn't loud volume) on my way to the room.The breakfast was simple,nothing to say, but they were putting on the table 2 or 3 times per morning 4 thin slices of ham and cheese while ppl were eating . I wouldn't have written this review if they had a honest site. In a few words, I wouldn't go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: madeingermany
Reviews.Content: First timers to Rome we were very pleased with this quaint hotel on the fourth floor. Upon arrival the front desk gentleman was extremely helpful. Told us the ins and outs of Rome. The room was basic for Europe and it was clean. If you are going to Rome to stay in your room this isnt the place for you. If you need a clean bed and bath then I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sunvalleyjodi
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip ever to Europe. Thankfully I had read a lot of hotel reviews so nothing surprised me about how small the rooms were in Italy. Hotel Argentina was no exception. The bathroom was actually larger than I had imagined but the shower was dark. Since our room window faced into a narrow courtyard, the room was dark. The beds were comfortable and we had easy access to the air conditioning. The breakfast room was tiny but adequate. The buffet selection was very limited but was fine for our needs. Mohad was our favorite receptionist. Always smiling and cheerful. Thankfully this was the first 4 days of a 14 day trip b/c climbing the 5 flights of stairs to our room was exhausting. Yes there was a "lift" but it was tiny and very slow. We only used it for transporting our luggage. For the price and convenience I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: TravelWise78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Argentina Hotel in March for 3 days - two rooms for a family of four. My parent's room was updated and remodeled, but the room my sister and I stayed in was not. It was a very simple, no frills room. It was clean, but the towels were terrible - paper thin and one day when I opened my towel, there was a huge whole in the middle. Our room was on the street and was very noisy. Also, even though there was a door at the end of the hallway before entering the breakfast room, it was extremely noisy early in the morning from the people getting breakfast. Speaking of the breakfast - it was not very good. They did not even serve fresh coffee - it came from a machine. The staff was friendly. The location was good if you want to take a metro to the center. You can walk to the center also, but you might as well find a hotel in the center if you want to do that. We stayed at this hotel because it was close to the train station and to a metro stop, so it served that purpose for us. In summary, the hotel was average. It was clean and inexpensive. If you are traveling on a budget, it is not a terrible place to stay, but don't expect much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Toursit101
Reviews.Content: We satyed in the Hotel Argentina for 3 nights, and had a very nice stay. The hotel is situated right by the Termini Station (2-3 minutes walk, if you come from Fiumiccino you should take the leonardo Express, it's the best way), in a main and busy street but the hotel is quiet. We only saw receptionists, and they all were very nice. Our room was very comfortable and the shower was renewed so it was very fresh. As others have said here, when walking on Via Cavour look at all the hotel signs, and you'll find this hotel right by a very nice restaurant, Tudini. Take the (tiny) elevator to the 4th floor and you'll find the reception desk there. If you're looking for a very central hotel, then you should consider hotels in the Spanish Steps area, but do know that Argentina is only 15 minutes walk from Plaza Espagana and the Spanish Steps. It's also very close the the Historical center and we walked everywhere. Have Fun!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel at a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: syyeung
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to Central Train Station. Finding it may be a little bit tricky as it shares the building with a couple of other hotels. Service is ok. Room is clean. There really isn't much negatives about this hotel, and overall it is a very good choice for travellers on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in March 2006 staying at the cuadruple room. The room was big enough for a family of 4, the washroom renovated and the continental breakfast fantastic because you can order real capuccino. The people in charge are incredibly nice and helpfull. The hotel is located on the 4th floor of an old building, you have to put atention to the sign on the street, but it is 2 minutes from the Termini. Make the reservation at their site directly. For 118 euro for 4 people with such a breakfast it is a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: McBlane
Reviews.Content: The worst thing about this hotel is the access to it but once you reach the 4th. floor it is quite pleasant. My single room was nicely furnished , had air conditioning, and was quiet being at the rear of the building. The bathroom was excellent.The only thing wrong with the room was the lack of a remote for the t.v. Breakfast was disappointing. I was also less than impressed by a small notice at reception which said "THE HOTEL STAFF EXPECT TO BE TIPPED" The surrounding area is certainly not the most attractive part of Rome but it is convenient for public transport and has lots of restaurants. If all you want is a good room near the station this hotel fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Good time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of the location and the pictures i saw. There were three of us; me,my husband and my mum. I asked a double and a single room for us. When we arrived we were a bit surprised by this hotel because hotel is in a big building along with other three hotels. Each hotel got section all over the building. This hotel kept some of the 4th and the 5th floor. They said my mum's room on the 4th floor while we had to go to 5th floor. If the hotel owned all of the 4th and 5th floors by itself there is no problem but there are other hotels and offices sharing the same floor. Each business got their section controlled by their reception by secured doors and locks, checked by staff and cameras 24 hours but that didnt put us at ease at first night. After a bit worried first night we were so comfortable in this hotel. It was very safe and all of the staff were very friendly and helpfull. Rooms were very clean and new. I think they should improve their breakfast little bit. We loved being in Rome and being with Italian people. We had the best pizza from the street market from a bakery stall. The restaurants werent very impressive around Termini station we chose the small and hidden ones for the best food. Location wise this hotel was fantastic, in the middle of everything.We used buses and metro very near to our hotel. You can buy daily metrobus ticket for 4euro. We can go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A week away”
Reviews.Author: Eoinzzz
Reviews.Content: Our room was quite spacious but not much of a view. The rest of Rome made up for that however. In fairness all we needed was a place to rest our heads. The hotel is within walking distance of most of the main archeological attractions of rome. If you aren't much of a walker then no fear as the "termini" (local train station) is a stone throw away and also the metro is around the corner. The staff are lovely and very friendly and had no problem helping us to get a taxi to the airport at 7am. If we were to return to Rome we would have no hesitation using Hotel Argentina again.

HotelInfo.Name: Argentina Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Cavour 47, 00184 Rome, Italy
